episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" features discussions on a historical beard and mustache show, the first Europeans to climb Kilimanjaro, a Mr. Bean impersonator in Wuhan, and the world's largest man-made waterfall owned by Donald Trump.

facts.fact: In 1873, members of the public came to watch bearded men stand on a stage and have their beards judged in what might be the first ever beard and mustache show.

To celebrate the 100-year anniversary of the first Europeans climbing Kilimanjaro, posthumous certificates were awarded to the African porters who helped them, including one who would have been 125 years old at his death.
A Mr. Bean impersonator was trapped in Wuhan during the coronavirus lockdown and became popular in China for his videos on how to stay healthy during the pandemic.
The largest man-made waterfall in the world is at the Trump National Westchester Golf Course, where every one of his courses has a fake waterfall.
